comments.body: Does this vend pysurfpack? Or is that wholly developed as part of dakota?

Dakota provides mainly an interface to many different scientific libraries (Trilinos, pecos, surfpack, ...) These libraries are included as git subrepos and the source is directly included in the release. Ideally every single library would have it's own conda-package. But this will increase the maintenance-difficulties. The external trilionos is already in conflict with this recipe.

Pysurfpack is a python binding to surfpack which is part of dakota. Pysurfpack are only a few wrapper files which are added by a patch and are not part of dakota.
This seems really weird.  Can you provide a link to what is and is not part of dakota.  If something is developed separately, it needs its own conda-forge package.

> If something is developed separately, it needs its own conda-forge package

I think trilinos is similar and it's also packages for conda-forge. 

> This seems really weird. Can you provide a link to what is and is not part of dakota.

Best to look at the cmake file.

This are packages listed as external packages:
```
option(HAVE_AMPL "Build the AMPL package." ON)
option(HAVE_CONMIN "Build the CONMIN package." ON)
option(HAVE_DDACE "Build the DDACE package." ON)
option(HAVE_DOT "Build the DOT package." ON)
option(HAVE_DREAM "Build the DREAM package." ON)
option(HAVE_FSUDACE "Build the FSUDACE package." ON)
option(HAVE_HOPSPACK "Build the hopspack package." ON)
option(HAVE_JEGA "Build the JEGA package." ON)
option(HAVE_NCSUOPT "Build the NCSUOPT package." ON)
option(HAVE_NL2SOL "Build the NL2SOL package." ON)
option(HAVE_NLPQL "Build the NLPQL package." ON)
option(HAVE_NOMAD "Build the NOMAD package." ON)
option(HAVE_NOWPAC "Build the NOWPAC package." OFF)
option(HAVE_NPSOL "Build the NPSOL package." ON)
option(HAVE_OPTPP "Build the OPTPP package." ON)
option(HAVE_PECOS "Build the Pecos package." ON)
option(HAVE_PLUGIN "Enable plugins to the dakota executable." ON)
option(HAVE_PSUADE "Build the PSUADE package." ON)
option(HAVE_SURFPACK "Build the Surfpack package." ON)
```
So all of those should be other conda-forge packages then?
I am not really sure. I guess keeping them compatible is easier by using source from dakota directly. Also I am not sure if any other project is using one of these libraries.
Well, if they are independently developed (ie in separate repos or with separate tarballs) then they should be sepearte packages

I guess this will be difficult, as the dakota release is more a bundle of compatible sources. Packaging strategy of dakota  seems to be a bit different (compared to conda-forge). While I would love to see all packages being added separately, I don't think this is feasible.
Ok, well, surfpack is only developed in dakota (https://dakota.sandia.gov/content/surfpack) which was my question. So this is fine.
